channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Why Democrats in a handful of states have shown hesitance toward redistricting
item.description: A handful of states led by Democrats could have attempted mid-decade redistricting to counter President Trump's push in GOP-led states, but aside from California, they have been slow to act.

item.title: After the death of Charlie Kirk, supporters wonder how to carry on his legacy
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of conservatives attended right wing activist Charlie Kirk's memorial service. Many now wonder who will fill the shoes of this influential voice in the conservative movement.

item.title: In Maine, prisoners are working remote jobs. The pay is a big draw
item.description: Dozens of people incarcerated in Maine are allowed to have laptops and hold down remote jobs. In some cases, they're making upwards of $60,000 a year.

item.title: Disney says 'Jimmy Kimmel Live!' will return to air tomorrow
item.description: ABC's parent company Disney says Jimmy Kimmel Live! will return back on the air Tuesday after suspending the show last week.

item.title: Inside the ICE facility at Ft. Bliss
item.description: The Washington Post obtained a report that found over 60 violations at an ICE detention facility. NPR's Ari Shapiro talks to Doug MacMillan, who obtained the report, about what it found.

item.title: Brazilians take to streets to oppose Bolsonaro amnesty
item.description: Thousands of Brazilians took to the streets over the weekend to oppose a bill that could pardon former President Jair Bolsonaro and his allies, recently sentenced to over 27 years for attempting a coup.

item.title: UN General Assembly meets on troubled 80th anniversary
item.description: The meeting includes a special conference called by France and Saudi Arabia to push for recognition of Palestinian statehood.

item.title: White House set to link autism and Tylenol in upcoming announcement
item.description: President Trump and HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. are expected to make remarks on a purported link between Tylenol and autism, and propose a cancer drug as a solution.

item.title: Conservative podcaster Michael Knowles speaks to Charlie Kirk's impact and legacy
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks with the conservative podcaster Michael Knowles, who was a friend of Charlie Kirk's and will headline tonight's show of The American Comeback Tour as a tribute to Kirk.

item.title: An early American music tradition gets a major update â€” and a younger audience
item.description: An old religiously inspired songbook that uses shape notes for people who can't read music got a major update and is attracting younger singers.
